{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Why is programming fun? What delights may its practitioner expect 
as his reward? First is the sheer joy of making things. As the child 
delights in his mud pie, so the adult enjoys building things, especially
 things of his own design. I think this delight must be an image of 
God's delight in making things, a delight shown in the distinctness and 
newness of each leaf and each snowflake.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"While some people write programs to solve important problems, or just to
 get a paycheck, many programmers actually enjoy the activity. Many mere
 mortals can't understand why.
Here are some of the things that programmers enjoy about programming:
","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Creativity","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
Programming is, in a way, like writing poetry or music. It is an 
intellectual activity where one creates structure out of nothing. And 
the things one creates can have significant value to others.
See also SoftwareIsArt","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Model Building","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"
One of the things a programmer does is to create elaborate logical 
models of the world (or other domains). A programmer constructs a bunch 
of things in an imaginary universe, and then sets them all in motion. 
And the programmer gets to set and to change the laws of these 
universes. This is fun in the same way that playing with model trains is
 fun.
","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}
